page.title: 05Shopping in St.Helens
page.content: In the centre of St.Helens there are three large shopping precincts,the La Grange Arcade,St.Mary's Arcade and the Hardshaw Centre.Roger La Grange was the mayor of Chalon in France when the Arcade was opened.As Chalon was a town twinned with St.Helens the mayor was invited to lay the foundation stone and to give his name to the arcade. People travel in to the town centre from miles around.Each of the precincts has a large area set aside for car parking,with an extra large car park within a few minutes walk. There are still many "corner-shops" where people can buy their goods.It is a good idea in case people forget things when they are in town or are unable to get to town.
